bibl.title: Davenport v. . Memo from the Sheriff
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Whatcom} ss
To the Sheriff of the County of Whatcom in said Territory.

Whereas Stephen Davenport of the County of Whatcom Washington Territory has been brought before me, the undersigned one of the Justices of the Peace in and for said County charged on the oath of Arthur Calene with having on the 12th day of September 1888 committed the crime of assault with the intent to commit murder, and whereas, on the examination of said Stephen Davenport in said cause, held before me on the 15th day of September 1888 it appeared that there was probable cause to believe that said crime had been committed by said Stephen Davenport in the manner charged in the affidavit of said Arthur Celene, and whereas, it was by one thereupon ordered that said Stephen Davenport be held to answer and await the action of one Grand Jury of the County of Whatcom in said Territory to be held and commanded at the next terms of the District Court holding terms at Whatcom these are therefor to Command you,
